required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Quebec Family Study (QFS): Role of Genetic Factors in Obesity and Its Related Risk Factors and Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: The Quebec Family Study: an Observational Study Aimed at Investigating the Role of Genetic Factors in Physical Fitness, Obesity and Risk Factors for Common Diseases and Health-related Behaviours

brief_summary.textblock: The Quebec Family Study (QFS) is an observational study that was planned to investigate the role of genetic factors in physical fitness, body composition, risk factors for common disease and health-related behaviour.

detailed_description.textblock: The Quebec Family Study was an observational study with three cycles of data collection between 1978 and 1992. During the first cycle of data collection (Phase 1: 1978-1982), a total of 1,650 subjects from 375 families were recruited. During the second cycle (Phase 2: 1989-1997), 385 subjects from 105 phase 1 families were retested and an additional 372 subject from 74 families were recruited. During the third cycle (Phase 3: 1998-2002), 204 subjects from phase 1 were tested a third time, 113 subjects from phase 2 were tested a second time and 194 new subjects from 44 families were recruited.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 24 years
primary_outcome.description: Body composition as assessed by underwater weighing

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 24 years
primary_outcome.description: Body mass index assessed from height and weight

biospec_descr.textblock: DNA is available from subjects that were enrolled in Phases 2 and 3 of the study

study_pop.textblock: The QFS cohort is a mixture of random sampling and ascertainment through obese individuals. In Phase 1 of the study, subjects were randomly selected from French-Canadian families living in the Quebec city area, In Phases 2 and 3 of the study, families with a least one obese parent and one obese offspring were recruited.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age over 10 years
Exclusion Criteria:

reference.citation: Chaput JP, Pérusse L, Després JP, Tremblay A, Bouchard C. Findings from the Quebec Family Study on the Etiology of Obesity: Genetics and Environmental Highlights. Curr Obes Rep. 2014 Jan 4;3:54-66. doi: 10.1007/s13679-013-0086-3. eCollection 2014. Review.
